reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: FLC: Strengthening Actions on Sexual Gender Based Violence (SASGBV) In Zanzibar 2019-2021

description.narrative: Sexual and Gender Based Violence (SGBV) constitutes a breach of fundamental rights to life liberty dignity and equality between women and men. In Zanzibar there are existing challenges tainted by cultural of secrecy stigma and lack of collective actions tr ansparency and accountability. GBV survivors often neglect the provision of evidence when the GBV incidences occurred or reported whether at Police stations or during hearing at courts of law. Strengthening Actions on Sexual Gender Based Violence (SASGBV)? is a two-year project expected to enhance actions on Sexual Gender Based Violence (SASGBV) by intensifying the generation of evidence engagement of actors and media advocacy in five districts of Zanzibar. Project aims at enhanced actions on Sexual Gender Based Violence (SGBV) by intensifying the generation of evidence engagement of actors and media advocacy in five districts of ZanzibarExpected outputs of the project are: At least 300 survivors (victims and their parents) from five districts empowered and sensitized to provide evidence for the facilitation of justice. Engaged 40 law enforcement agencies/GBV authorities from the office of DPP Police Court officials one stop Centre and Police Gender Desk to influence the implementation of Criminal Procedure A ct No 7 of 2018 and Evidence Act No 9 of 2017 to effect the provision of evidence against GBV incidentsEmpowered 10 Young media fellows to identify document and follow-up GBV cases and their progress in the project areasThe project will have trainings to g rassroots networks victims of SGBV information disseminations engage with law enforcement such as police judges/magistrates gender desks etc. engagement with media and CSOs networks. Beneficiaries of the project are GBV survivors with their parents Law en forcement agencies (Police DPP Police gender desk Court officials and one stop Centers Young Media Fellows (YMF)TAMWA is the implementing partner; it will work with other like-minded organizations especially on advocacy around the areas of gender equality and good governance.
